net.matuschek.util
Class ByteBuffer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.matuschek.util.ByteBuffer
public class ByteBuffer
extends java.lang.Object

A ByteBuffer implements a growable byte array. You can simple add bytes like you do it using a Vector, but internally the buffer is implemented as a real array of bytes. This increases memory usage.

Constructor Summary
ByteBuffer()
          Initializes a new ByteBuffer object and creates a temporary buffer array of a predefined initial size.

Constructor Detail

ByteBuffer

public ByteBuffer()
Initializes a new ByteBuffer object and creates a temporary buffer array of a predefined initial size. If you want to set your own initial size, use the setSize method after initializing the object.
Method Detail

append

public void append(byte b)
Appends a byte to the end of the buffer If the currently reserved memory is used, the size of the internal buffer will be doubled. In this case the memory usage will temprary increase by factor 3 because it need a temporary storage for the old data. Be sure that you have enough heap memory !
Parameters:
b - byte to append

length

public int length()
Returns:
the number of bytes stored in the buffer

getContent

public byte[] getContent()
Returns:
the buffer contents as a byte array

clean

public void clean()
removes all contents in the buffer

setSize

public void setSize(int size)
Sets the size of the internal buffer to the given value. This is useful, if the size of the data that should be stored is known.
Parameters:
size - size of the buffer in Bytes

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Print the buffer content as a String (use it for debugging only !)
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a String containing every byte in the buffer as a character

doubleBuffer

protected void doubleBuffer()
doubles the size of the internal buffer
